abstract: Op-Ed article by former German deputy foreign minister Wolfgang Ischinger offers insight into Germany's halting approach to Europe's sovereign debt crisis; asserts that while Germans firmly believe in European integration, they have never wholeheartedly embraced the euro.
snippet: Germans firmly believe in European integration, but they have never wholeheartedly embraced the euro.
lead_paragraph: Germans firmly believe in European integration, but they have never wholeheartedly embraced the euro.

headline.main: Germans Love Europe, but Not the Euro
headline.print_headline: Germans Love Europe, but Not the Euro
headline.seo: Germans Love Europe — But Not the Euro
